meanings.definition: A white or gray clay mineral consisting of aluminum silicate, used in ceramics and refractories.
meanings.sent1: Kaolinite is a type of clay mineral found in nature.
meanings.sent2: The potter used kaolinite to make the delicate ceramic vase.
meanings.sent3: When the kaolinite decided to take a pottery class, it realized it was already an expert in clay.
meanings.sent4: The kaolinite stood out in the ceramic world like a shining star.
meanings.sent5: The smooth texture of kaolinite makes it perfect for crafting beautiful pottery.

meanings.definition: A soft, earthy, white mineral, a hydrous silicate of aluminum, that is the principal constituent of kaolin.
meanings.sent1: Miners discovered a rich vein of kaolinite deep underground.
meanings.sent2: The artist used kaolinite to add a touch of elegance to the sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The kaolinite felt like a fancy mineral at the Earth's party.
meanings.sent4: Her skin was as pure and smooth as kaolinite.
meanings.sent5: The kaolinite sparkled in the sunlight, resembling a precious gemstone.
